content: Hey all, I was hopping to pick up an ICE-breaker sooner rather than later. I was wondering if there are some default environment I should setup to speed up my efficiency. For example, should I compile rustc in debug mode locally, or use some kind of instrumentation? What is a good debug environment to setup when debugging rustc?
@Siavosh Zarrasvand have you checked rustc-guide?
I suggest you to read it in general but in particular there are sections of it that talks about setting up your environment
Nope, you mean for instructions to compile rustc with debug flags?

I suggest you to read it in general but in particular there are sections of it that talks about setting up your environment

Cool, will do. this one right? https://rust-lang.github.io/rustc-guide/
yeah in general for building your developing rustc environment

I suggest you to read it in general but in particular there are sections of it that talks about setting up your environment

Cool, will do. this one right? https://rust-lang.github.io/rustc-guide/

yes, that one
and in general I recommend you to start here https://rust-lang.github.io/rustc-guide/ice-breaker/llvm.html

and in general I recommend you to start here https://rust-lang.github.io/rustc-guide/ice-breaker/llvm.html

Awesome! Thank you!
